text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Atari 7800 ProSystem is a console released by Atari Corporation in January 1986 in collaboration with arcade game creator GCC. It rivals the NES and Master System with its ability to display hundreds of moving sprites on screen at once. Equipped with an Atari SALLY 6502C CPU, a MARIA custom GPU and 4KB of RAM, it could display up to 320x240 pixels and up to 256 different colors (16 colors with 16 intensities). It uses a simplified 2-button controller and can run Atari 2600 games, making it the first backwards compatible console.
